title: الْمُضَارِعُ الْمَجْزُوم
description: Learn jussive with لَمْ, لَمَّا, لَا (prohibition): لَمْ يَذْهَبْ (he did not go), لَمَّا يَكْتُبْ (he has not yet written).

notes.title: The Jussive Mood (المضارع المجزوم)
content: The jussive mood (مجزوم) is triggered by specific particles. The verb loses its final vowel, taking sukūn instead.
The main particles that cause the jussive are: لَمْ (did not), لَمَّا (not yet), لَا الناهية (prohibitive don't), and conditional particles.
keyPoints: لَمْ - 'did not' (negates past): لَمْ يَذْهَبْ (He did not go)
لَمَّا - 'not yet': لَمَّا يَكْتُبْ (He has not yet written)
The verb ending changes: يَذْهَبُ → لَمْ يَذْهَبْ
For the five verbs (الأفعال الخمسة), the نون is dropped: يَذْهَبُونَ → لَمْ يَذْهَبُوا

notes.title: Difference Between لَمْ and لَمَّا
content: Both particles negate past actions, but لَمَّا implies the action is still expected to happen.
keyPoints: لَمْ - simple past negation: لَمْ يَحْضُرْ (He did not attend)
لَمَّا - not yet, expected later: لَمَّا يَحْضُرْ (He has not attended yet)
لَمَّا implies continuation of the non-occurrence up to now
